Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi knocked in Miguel Vargas with a single to left-center against left-handed reliever José Quijada in the 10th inning, giving the Sox a 4-3 victory
Korey Lee put the Sox ahead with a two-run home run in the second inning
Lenyn Sosa hit a solo home run with one out in the fourth inning
The Angels tied the game with a pair of two-out runs in the fourth
Michael Stefanic executed an excellent bunt on a squeeze play and made it to first safely when no one was covering the bag for an RBI single, tying the score at 3
A few moments later, Benintendi delivered the one-out single to left-center to win the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Sox remained tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in a season during Major League Baseball’s modern era
The expansion '62 Mets finished 40-120. The Sox are 38-120 with four games remaining
We’re trying to finish strong, obviously, it’s been a long year and I feel like we’ve been talking about it all year, but there’s four more left and we’re trying to make the most out of it
Post-Match Reflections: Any time you can walk off, it’s a great feeling. Great energy in the clubhouse. Guys love that. We’re trying to build something here, these are the kinds of games you can create some momentum with, especially here late in the year
It’s just nice to see and hopefully we can finish it off (in Thursday’s series finale) and move on to Detroit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sox secured a series victory and held off history for another day

The game went to extra innings. The Angels had runners on first and second with no outs in the top of the 10th, and reliever Jared Shuster got Eric Wagaman to double play started by shortstop Nicky Lopez. With a runner on third, Matt Thaiss flew out to Benintendi in left field to end the inning
